summary: This document appears to be a compilation of exhibits presented to a grand jury in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes property addresses, a 1994 letter from Interlochen Arts Camp thanking Jeffrey Epstein for a donation, several flight logs from 1994-1998, a student application form, and excerpts from Ghislaine Maxwell's 2016 deposition where she denies knowledge of Epstein's alleged scheme to recruit underage girls and denies giving massages.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the recipient of a thank-you letter from Interlochen Arts Camp for a $20,000 donation for a scholarship lodge. Referenced in deposition questions regarding alleged sexual activities and recruitment of underage girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the grand jury proceeding. Named in a 1994 letter alongside Epstein. Subject of a 2016 deposition where she denies knowledge of Epstein's alleged scheme to recruit underage girls and denies giving him or anyone massages.

persons.name: Leslie Fagin
persons.context: Identified as the court reporter and notary public who recorded the videotaped depositions of Ghislaine Maxwell on April 22 and July 22, 2016.

persons.name: Mr. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney objecting to the form and foundation of questions during Ghislaine Maxwell's 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Perlman
persons.context: Mentioned in the 1994 Interlochen letter as giving a concert on August 7, 1994. Likely a reference to violinist Itzhak Perlman.

connections.description: Mentioned together in the Interlochen thank-you letter. In her deposition, Maxwell testifies about her past romantic/sexual relationship with Epstein.
Pagliuca objects to deposition questions on Maxwell's behalf, indicating he is acting as her legal counsel.
Epstein's donation to Interlochen is linked to a Perlman concert date, suggesting a social or philanthropic connection to the arts institution.

events.title: Interlochen Thank You Letter
events.description: Interlochen Arts Camp sends a letter thanking Jeffrey Epstein for a $20,000 donation for a new scholarship lodge, noting tax benefits and offering him two weeks of use per year.

events.title: Perlman Concert at Interlochen
events.description: Itzhak Perlman is scheduled to give a concert at Interlochen Arts Camp, as noted in the thank-you letter to Epstein.

events.title: Flight Log
events.description: A flight log entry, one of several included from 1994-1998. The document is garbled but indicates travel activity.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition (Part 1)
events.description: Videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell is taken at the law offices of Boies Schiller & Flexner in New York. She is questioned about Epstein's activities.

events.title: Maxwell Deposition (Part 2)
events.description: Continued videotaped deposition of Ghislaine Maxwell. She denies awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house and knowledge of his sexual activities with others.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico
The Villard House, 457 Madison Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Law offices of BOIES SCHILLER & FLEXNER, 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein made a $20,000 charitable donation to Interlochen Arts Camp in 1994, which funded a 'scholarship lodge' he was permitted to use for two weeks each year.
Ghislaine Maxwell, in a 2016 deposition, denied knowledge of any scheme by Jeffrey Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages.
Maxwell testified under oath that she was not aware of Epstein having sexual activities with anyone other than herself and two other women on a few occasions in the 1990s/2000s.
Maxwell testified that she never gave Jeffrey Epstein or anyone else a massage.
The document includes multiple flight log entries from 1994-1998, though the specific passenger details are garbled in the provided text.
